Package control

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • control.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
implements java.util.Observer
    This class handles dual connection to allow 1vs1 battleship duels. If a player disconnects, the connected player is sent back to the server queue. and this
    Author:
    DigitalVilla

        Parameters:
        client - the Socket to be added

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady​()
        This method informs the current capacity of the ArrayList clients
        Returns:
        It will return true only when there are 2 Socket clients in the ArrayList clients.

      • update

        public void update​(java.util.Observable listener,
                   java.lang.Object args)
        Specified by:

      • gameLogic

        private void gameLogic​(int clientNumber)
        This method sends a DataPacket opposite to the sender.
        Parameters:
        clientNumber - the clientNumber of the sender.

      • disconnect

        private void disconnect​(int clientNumber)
        This method: 1) Sends a DataPacket opposite to the sender. 2) Closes the sender's Socket. 3) Sends the remaining Socket client back to the Connection's queueList.
        Parameters:
        clientNumber - the clientNumber of the sender.

      • connectionLogic

        private void connectionLogic​()
        This method alerts players of main phases within the game using int counter. At 0: Randomly select the First. At 2: Players must interchange their board cells. At 4: Game attacks starts. At 5: Sets a 10 second timer to disconnect if a player does not accept a rematch. At 6: When both players agree on a rematch startNewGame() is called.

      • setWriters

        private void setWriters​()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the ObjectOutputReaders for each Socket Client and calls startNewGame()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown by ObjectOutputStream.

      • startNewGame

        public void startNewGame​()
        This method resets the ClientHandler to start a new game with the same players. It notifies clients about each other
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Exception thrown by Thread.sleep(milliseconds).

      • sendPacket

        public void sendPacket​()
        Sends a packet to both clients, usually used for the chat connection It is synchronized to avoid multiple calls at the same time.
